Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk yum-NetworkManager-dispatcher
exit 0

exit 0

exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk yum-plugin-tsflags
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: yum-utils bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The yum-utils packages provide a collection of utilities and examples for the yum package manager to make yum easier and more powerful to use. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the yumdownloader utility accepted only a certain naming scheme of source repositories, which Certificate-based Red Hat Network content delivery network (CDN) did not follow. As a consequence, the yumdownloader and yum-builddep utilities did not work with the source repositories created in CDN. With this update, support for the new naming scheme of source repositories has been added, and yumdownloader and yum-builddep now work with source CDN repositories as intended. (BZ#1082050) Prior to this update, the needs-restarting utility used an incorrect method for determining the process start time. With this update, needs-restarting has been modified to find the correct process start time, thus fixing this bug. (BZ#1095150) Preivously, attempts to download a package using the yumdownloader utility failed if the same package of a bigger size was present in the destination directory. Consequently, the package was not redownloaded, and a vague error message was displayed. A patch for handling already downloaded packages has been applied, and yumdownloader now redownloads packages in the aforementioned scenario. (BZ#1104995) In case of dependency errors, the yumdownloader utility did not inform the user about them. With this update, yumdownloader has been modified to print all dependency error messages as expected. (BZ#1113391) Previously, when a package was removed and the yum post-transaction-action extension for a changed directory was enabled, the "yum remove" command terminated unexpectedly. A patch has been provided to fix the bug, "yum remove" no longer crashes, and post-transaction-action is fulfilled successfully. (BZ#1127782) Prior to this update, the yum-config-manager utility did not accept standard wildcard characters in its input. This update adds support for wildcards to yum-config-manager. (BZ#1129590) Previously, the "reposync -u" command exited after processing the first enabled repository. This bug has been fixed, and "reposync -u" now correctly processes all enabled repositories. (BZ#1133125) With this update, the yum-plugin-post-transaction-actions plug-in has been modified to accept the colon characters in the command part of .action files. (BZ#1134989) Prior to this update, the reposync utility did not create the correct directory infrastructure, which resulted in packages and metadata files being located in the same directory. This problem has been fixed, and reposync always creates the correct directory infrastructure. (BZ#1139032) Prior to this update, when running the "reposync -u" command to report on items to be downloaded, the report always showed that all items needed to be downloaded even if they already resided in the local repository. This bug hasbeen fixed, and "reposync -u" now reports correctly. (BZ#1140864) Users of yum-utils are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
